snippet: Cuts to food stamps reflect the lapse of a temporary increase in benefits created by the Obama administration’s stimulus program, and are likely to deepen.
abstract: Cuts to food stamp program means millions of Americans receiving aid will have to get by with less government assistance every month, move that will not only cost them money they use to feel their families but also is expected to dampen economic growth; cuts reflect lapse of temporary increase in benefits created by Obama administration’s stimulus program; cuts will be $5 billion in fiscal 2014, and another $6 billion over 2015 and 2016 fiscal years.
lead_paragraph: Cuts to food stamps reflect the lapse of a temporary increase in benefits created by the Obama administration’s stimulus program, and are likely to deepen.

headline.main: As Cuts to Food Stamps Take Effect, More Trims to Benefits Are Expected
headline.print_headline: As Cuts to Food Stamps Take Effect, More Trims to Benefits Are Expected
